bug.author: mortont
bug.summary: Build failure when installing via pip
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When installing fairseq from pip (or locally via master) the build fails at libnat. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: (from a fresh virtualenv)
pip install fairseq
or (also from a fresh virtualenv)
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq cd fairseq pip install --editable .
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/files/4119034/out.log>Full error log</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The install to complete without error <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.4.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Arch Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source (also fails with pip) Build command you used (if compiling from source): pip install --editable . Python version: 3.7.6 CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 10.2.89 cuDNN 7.6.5.32 GPU models and configuration: GTX 1080 Ti

comments.comment: Seems like this was an error with PyTorch, fixed it by building and installing PyTorch with the patches discussed <denchmark-link:https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/65202>here</denchmark-link> .
